feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Fiori
feed.subtitle: SAP Fiori Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Accessing Standard-Fiori App in Mobile
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I would like to make a standard SAP Fiori application accessible on a mobile device. My goal is to expose this app as a mobile application, but without utilizing SAP BTP. Since it is a standard app, I would prefer to achieve this solely using the Fiori Launchpad and user credentials. However SAP Start needs BTP excess to make this.

Could you please suggest any other possible approaches or best practices to make this feasible?

entry.title: Restrict the app F2175 Find Maintenance Order to show orders that an user is responsible for
entry.content:
Hello Everyone - I would like to restrict the orders displayed in the app, F2175 (Find Maintenance Order). I searched in SAP Community and could not find helpful information. Any pointers on how this can be achieved would be of great help.

Steps:

Access the app from launchpad

Clicking on the GO button should display only orders that I am responsible for.

I know we can do "Adapt Filters" and restrict on our personnel number. But this is a user specific setting. I want to restrict based on "Personnel Number" entered.

Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: Reported By doesn't show all users in Request Maintenance App (F1511)
entry.content:
Hello,

When we try to create a "Request Maintenance" using the Request Maintenance App (F1511), my user does not appear in the "Reported By" field. I do have a user account in the S/4HANA environment. We have tried creating an HR Master Record (PA30) and also set up a Business Partner (BP), but none of these steps have resolved the issue.

We are performing this validation in our development system as part of a new EAM project implementation. In the development environment, HR Master data is not synchronized with SuccessFactors, so we do not have access to all HR Master records. For this reason, we are attempting to create users manually.

Any guidance or pointers on how to resolve this would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you,
Phani

entry.title: How to use $top and $skip bindList in OData V4
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We have an interesting problem.

We developed a  Web Page ODatav4 and use bindList to Read OData V4.  Howerver, I don't use $top and $skip in mParameters.

Can you help me how to use $top and $skip in Odata V4?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: How do we change the SCMON job execution to run for a specific period of days?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

The SCMON is configured in our ABAP system and the report is being generated with the proper objects. How can we run the job one time for a period of 400 days? Additionally, what are the differences between a one-time run and a continuous run with respect to the results produced?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: How do use AL11 in SAP Fiori/UI5 App?
entry.content:
I have created a custom UI5 application which have an input field for an input file. It should have a functionality to upload from local file or upload to AL11.

 

Assuming that I will be using an OData for service for this, is it possible to upload the file in AL11 via front end?

entry.title: 403 Forbidden Error in Personas when using Slipstream Engine...
entry.content:
Hi Gurus, @Tamas_Hoznek @vananko 

I am getting 403 Forbidden Error when using Slipstream Engine... This is used to work correctly...

This Error is happening as soon as we make any change on screen (EWM RF). Please help with any suggestion in case you faced or have seen this error. All Roles are assigned correctly (It worked correctly earlier), we have not made any changes that we are aware of.

This error is happening even in Idle situation, means without click on SAVE button... 

Observation : When we see F12 console, we are seeing multiple Screens numbers data is getting posted. We have not made any changes to these screens. Any way we can stop these screens to get posted if there is no change there ?

Observation 2 : Draft record Popup is not appearing... Observed that when Draft record Popup appears and we select reload Draft data then Error is not happening. This scenario happened 3 times and every time I was able to Save successfully changes... But now that Draft Popup stopped appearing even we see Draft entries in table...

Thanks-

Abhishek

entry.title: Implementing "Add Card to Insights" in a Fiori Elements List Report Application
entry.content:
I am trying to implement the Add Card to Insights feature in my Fiori Elements List Report application but have encountered issues. Below is an overview of my application and the problem:

  • Type: Fiori Elements App (based on sap.fe.core.fpm)
  • OData Version: V4 with List Report
  • Customization:
    • Explicitly declared Variant Management in the XML view since it wasn't supported via the manifest.
    • Extended with a Custom XML View + Controller.

I want to enable the Add Card to Insights functionality for my List Report table. I attempted to configure this using the following controlConfiguration in my manifest.json:

"controlConfiguration": {
  "@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem": {
    "tableSettings": {
      "type": "ResponsiveTable",
      "enableAddCardToInsights": true
    }
  }
}

 

However, this configuration did not work.

then

I manually called a POST request to the INSIGHTS_CARDS endpoint with dummy data for a card. The response indicated: "message": "Insights is inactive" with error code /UI2/INSIGHTS_MSG/008.

but
I'm getting XML response when i try to access this below metadata

/sap/opu/odata4/ui2/insights_srv/srvd/ui2/insights_cards_read_srv/0001/INSIGHTS_CARDS$metadata

entry.content:
Hello

I would like to know, for the Fiori Application Accrual Postings Simulated Posted, how the measures "Simulated A/D Amt" are fed for the report. 

Which SAP tables or fields are data source for theses measures ?

Thanks in advance

Pierre

entry.title: Calling cloud foundry application using rest api via destination from fiori in BAS
entry.content:
I have deployed my backend developed using python in the cloud foundry dev space with the Oauth2.0 security. I can access it using all the credentials from postman without any problem.

I created a destination for the application and checked it. It shows "Connection to "NewCrew" established. Response returned: "200: OK" "

Now I want to call this application using the destination  I created from the fiori application.

I created a Fiori UI using Basic Fiori Template. I didn't create a MTA 

# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://sap.github.io/ui5-tooling/schema/ui5.yaml.json

specVersion: "3.1"
metadata:
  name: fioricrew
type: application
server:
  customMiddleware:
    - name: fiori-tools-proxy
      afterMiddleware: compression
      configuration:
        ignoreCertError: true # If set to true, certificate errors will be ignored. E.g. self-signed certificates will be accepted
        backend:
          - path: /app
            destination: NewCrew
            pathReplace: ""
            forwardAuthToken: true
        ui5:
          path:
            - /resources
            - /test-resources
          url: https://ui5.sap.com
        debug: true
    - name: fiori-tools-appreload
      afterMiddleware: compression
      configuration:
        port: 35729
        path: webapp
        delay: 300
    - name: fiori-tools-preview
      afterMiddleware: fiori-tools-appreload
      configuration:
        flp:
          theme: sap_horizon

 This is my UI5.yaml .

{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [

    {
      "source": "^/app/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "NewCrew",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "forwardAuthToken": true

    },
    {
      "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
   
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
      
    }
  ]
}

This is my xs-app.json.

 _callAIService: function (sQuery) {
            const sUrl = "/app/api/query"; 
            const oPayload = {
                "user_request": sQuery
            };

            // Add a "typing..." indicator for better UX
            this._addMessageToChat("...", "ai_typing");
        
            let oResponse; // Variable to hold the response object
        
            fetch(sUrl, {
                method: "POST",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
                body: JSON.stringify(oPayload)
            })
            .then(response => {
                oResponse = response; // Store the response so we can access it in the catch block
                if (!response.ok) {
                    // Throw an error to be caught by the .catch block
                    throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`);
                }
                return response.json();
            })

This is my View1.controller.js 

this is all the files I have.

I used ui5 serve to test the application.

I always get the 500 error.  I tried to debug using developer tools on chrome but this is all I could find 
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 ()
Im trying to access the backend from the BAS using the destination I configured. 
I have tried all the tutorials and videos out there but I couldn't get this to work. 

Im new to SAP and I don't know what Im doing wrong. Every video I watched they all used odatagen. I have no clue what I'm doing wrong here. i have default-env.json as well. Im trying to make it work for a week but I couldn't. Please someone help me in this.

entry.title: SAPUI5 Localization with i18n in annotations.xml not working
entry.content:
Hello,

I try to override annotations coming from backend OData service for SmartTable Headers with a local annotation.xml.

The local annotations file has been created using the Service Modeler.

I added some Annotations to the file, but it always states "Text key is not available. 'i18n.properties' file is missing or not registered in 'manifest.json' fileannotation-service(missing-i18n-key)". The problem is in line 39 of annotations.xml with the key "IsAssigned".

i18n is defined in manifest.json and the key I want to use is defined in i18n.properties.

I attached the manifest.json, the i18n.properties and the annotations.xml, maybe someone here has a solution for my problem.

Thank you!

entry.content:

I have a custom z-field in table KNB1 which is available to use in the "dynamic selections" tab in transaction "FBL5N" (Customer Line Item Display). I now want said field to be available in Fiori-App F0711  but I am not quite sure how to do this.

Is this achievable by using the "Custom Fields and Logic" (F1481) App or what is the best way to do this?

Thank you in advance for any advice 🙂

entry.title: "Camel execution failed” Error on Fiori Registration (Only in Production) / Impact of Variable Table
entry.content:
Title:

“Camel execution failed” Error on Fiori Registration (Only in Production) / Impact of Variable Table Reference?

Question:

■ Overview

In our Fiori application, an error occurs when clicking the Register button on a transactional entry screen.
The same code works fine in the test environment, but fails in the production environment.

■ Environment Setup (Simplified)

  • CDS view is used to read cost department master data (name anonymized)
  • Backend is Node.js, accessing CDS via CAP service
  • The CDS view references a table, passed via variable in the service

■ Environment Differences

The referenced table has a higher record count in production (e.g. test: 3,000 records, production: 3,500 records).
CDS view definitions and service logic are identical across environments.

■ Error Message (Excerpt)

 
[SqlError: internal error: Camel execution failed. Reason: Cannot process result] { code: 403, sqlState: 'HY000' }

We noticed the generated SQL contains something like JSON_TABLE('{}'), which may be contributing to the failure when handling empty JSON input under certain conditions.

■ Code Example (with variable table name)

Here is the original code using a variable for the table name:

 

 
const result = await this.tx.run(
    SELECT.one.from(table).where(conditions)
);

This code causes a 403 error only in the production environment.

■ Temporary Fix (working version)

When we explicitly provided the table name as a string, the issue was resolved:

const table = 'Z_ACTUAL_COST_DEPT_MASTER'; // ← anonymized actual table name const result = await this.tx.run( SELECT.one.from(table).where(conditions) );

■ Questions

  1. What could be the root cause of the Camel execution failed. Reason: Cannot process result error in this context?
  2. Could the use of JSON_TABLE('{}') in the CDS-generated SQL cause issues in production due to volume or empty JSON input?
  3. Is it possible that using SELECT.from(variable) in CDS behaves differently across environments (e.g. due to view resolution)?
  4. Are there any best practices for safely referencing tables via variables in CDS views, especially for production stability?

■ Notes

  • Table names and record counts are anonymized.

  • I can provide HANA version and CDS definitions if needed.

entry.title: FF7B filtering
entry.content:
Hi all,

I would like to view FF7B (Cash Management and Forecast: Currency overview) with specific filters.

For example, view currency by month, but only specific customer levels and specific groups.
Currently this means going into each different currency, then summary level "Customer", then Planning level, filtering only specific groups, export to Excel and repeat for next currency.

Surely this can't be the bext SAP has to offer. Is it possible to achieve such filters and views for FF7B?
So for example I would have something like this:

CurrencySummary LevelPlanning LevelG/L AccountJulyAugustSeptemberOctoberNovemberDecember
CHFCustomerS1E2xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
CHFCustomerS1E3xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

USD

CustomerS1

E2

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

USD

CustomerS1

E3

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

entry.title: SAPFPAYM not triggered automatically after F110 / Manage Automatic Payments
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am facing an issue with Payment Medium Workbench (PMW) in S/4HANA.
When I run F110 (or Manage Automatic Payments), the payment run finishes successfully, payments are posted, and the payment advice notes are generated.

However, the payment medium file (DME) is not automatically created.
I always need to go to SE38 and run SAPFPAYM manually to generate the payment medium file.

In Manage Payment Media, the status of my items is usually "Downloaded", and I cannot change it to "To Be Generated".

Here are additional details:

  • Payment method is correctly assigned to DMEE format (e.g., FI_PAYMEDIUM_DMEE_CGI_05)

  • Program RFFOAVIS_FPAYM is assigned in the "Printout/Data Medium" tab of the payment method

  • In DME Administration (DMEEADMIN), I can see my file with "Data transmitted to external" checked

  • No DME file is found in AL11 unless I manually run SAPFPAYM

My question:

  • How can I configure F110 so that SAPFPAYM is automatically triggered during the payment run, without having to execute it manually?

  • Do I need to adjust the Payment Medium Workbench (PMW) selection variant, or maintain a missing link in the payment method customizing?

  • Could the status "Downloaded" in Manage Payment Media block the automatic generation?

Any advice or guidance on customizing steps to make SAPFPAYM run automatically after F110 would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData Annotation (Code Based)
entry.content:
Hello,

I want to create a Tree Table with Fiori Elements using SEGW, but I'm not able to do so.

I try to follow this posts:
Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData... - SAP Community
Fiori Elements Tree Table with SAP Annotations - SAP Community

This is my data table:

This are the fields:

 

These are my CDS Views:

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@EndUserText.label: 'Intermediate View for Tree Structure'

define view entity ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ztree_table

{

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

nodename,

nodedescription

}

 

@EndUserText.label: 'Konsumptions-View für ZTREE_TABLE'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

//@OData.publish: true

@UI.headerInfo: {

typeName: 'Knoten',

typeNamePlural: 'Knoten'

}

@Hierarchy.parentChild: [{

name: 'TreeHierarchy',

recurse: {

parent: ['parentid'],

child: ['id']

},

siblingsOrder: [{

by: 'nodename',

direction: #ASC

}],

rootNode: {

visibility: #ADD_ROOT_NODE_IF_DEFINED

},

orphanedNode: {

handling: #ROOT_NODES

}

}]

define view entity ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

{

 

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Node Name' }]

nodename,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Node Description' }]

nodedescription

}

 

 

In SEGW I created a project and the did a right click on "Data Model"  then "Reference" / "Data Source" and chose my ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE. Icreated the runtime objects and redefined the method "define" in my *MPC_EXT class with the following code:


METHOD define.
  super->define( ).

  DATA: lr_entity    TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_entity_typ,
        lr_property  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_property,
        lr_annotation TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotation.

  lr_entity = model->get_entity_type( iv_entity_name = 'ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTUREType' ).
  IF lr_entity IS BOUND.

    " 1. id als Knoten-ID
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'id' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 2. RELATKEY als Parent Node
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'parentid' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_parent_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 3. SeqNo als Hierarchieebene
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'hierlevel' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_level_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 4. drill_state als Drill-Down-Zustand
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'drilldownstate' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_drill_state_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

  ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

If I create then the Responsive Table in the BAS, it shows me my data correctly. When I change to type "TreeTable", it shows me "No data found".

What am I doing wrong?

Thanks and best regards
Thomas

@MR_srinivas 
@SumitKundu 
@jmalla

entry.title: SAP BAS asks me for credentials to perform a deployment
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am trying to do a deplot with these commands:
npm run deploy-config and then npm run deploy
and both ask me for credentials.
In SAP, I have SAP_ALL and I don't use the ATO service, so I don't understand why this is happening.
Here are some screenshots:

#Deploy SAPUI5 ~#FIORI #BTP
